Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Deluxe Corporation (NYSE: DLX) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
Deluxe Corporation (DLX), founded in 1915 and headquartered in Shoreview, Minnesota, is a leading provider of payment, data, and marketing solutions primarily targeting small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), financial institutions, and merchants. Historically dominant in check printing (once processing ~50% of U.S. checks), Deluxe has pivoted to a fintech-focused model amid the digital payments shift. Its three core segments include: (1) Small Business Services (~45% of revenue), offering checks, forms, marketing/promotional materials, and loyalty programs; (2) Financial Institution Services (~30%), providing data management, treasury management, account conversion tools, and fraud prevention; and (3) Merchant Services (~25%), delivering payment processing, point-of-sale (POS) systems, and embedded finance via Deluxe Payment Exchange (DPX). With ~3,600 employees and operations across North America, Deluxe serves over 4 million SMB customers and 4,400 financial institutions. Revenue is diversified: ~60% recurring/subscription-based. The company emphasizes digital transformation, leveraging acquisitions and proprietary tech like AI-driven analytics to counter secular check declines (down ~7-10% annually). In 2023, total revenue was $2.28B, with a focus on high-margin fintech (gross margins ~50%+). Deluxe pays a quarterly dividend (current yield ~4.4%) and trades at a forward P/E of ~9x, appealing to value investors amid SMB recovery post-COVID. (198 words)

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, via Yahoo Finance/Nasdaq):
- Price: $22.39
- Market Cap: $994.2M
- Shares Outstanding: 44.42M
- 52-Week Range: $16.21 - $24.87
- Dividend Yield: 4.40% ($0.60 annualized)

## Recent Developments
- **July 31, 2024**: Q2 2024 earnings – Revenue $593.7M (+2.2% YoY), Adjusted EBITDA $118.9M (+3.1% YoY), Diluted EPS $0.37 (GAAP) / $1.06 (adjusted, +24.7% YoY). Small Business revenue +3.7%, Merchant Services +15.1%.
- **July 31, 2024**: Raised FY2024 guidance – Revenue +1-2% (~$2.31-2.33B), Adjusted EBITDA +4-6% (~$482-492M).
- **October 1, 2024**: Announced integration milestones from March 2024 DOXIM acquisition, adding customer communications platform; expected $15M+ synergies by end-2025.
- **September 12, 2024**: Launched AI-powered "Deluxe Business Insights" for SMBs, enhancing data analytics in marketing services (per company press release).
- **Q3 2024 Earnings Preview**: Scheduled for October 30, 2024; analysts expect revenue ~$588M (flat YoY), EPS $0.98 (via Seeking Alpha/Zacks consensus).
- Ongoing discussions (Reddit/StockTwits, Oct 2024): Investor focus on dividend sustainability and merchant growth amid high interest rates.

## Growth Strategy
- Accelerate digital payments via DPX platform (target: 20%+ annual growth in merchant services).
- Expand embedded finance and partnerships with banks/fintechs for SMB lending/data.
- M&A-driven: $300M+ deployed since 2022 for fintech bolt-ons (e.g., DOXIM for docs automation).
- Organic: Cross-sell digital tools to check customers (conversion rate target 15-20%); invest $50M+ annually in tech/R&D.
- FY2024-2026 targets: Revenue CAGR 3-5%, EBITDA margins 21-23%, free cash flow $200M+ annually.

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Check volumes declining 7-10% YoY (Q2 2024: -8%); integration risks from DOXIM (one-time costs $10M). | Merchant Services +15% YoY (Q2); recurring revenue at 60%+; strong free cash flow ($102M TTM). |
| **Sector**  | Digital shift eroding legacy print (fintech payments market fragmented); rising rates pressure SMB borrowing. | SMB optimism (NFIB index up 2024); U.S. merchant acquiring market $200B+ growing 8% CAGR (Nilson Report 2024). |

## Existing & New Products/Services
- **Existing**:
  - Checks/forms (40% revenue; #1 U.S. SMB provider).
  - DPX: Cloud-based payments/POS for merchants (processes $10B+ annually).
  - Data Solutions: Fraud detection, KYC, treasury mgmt for 4,400+ FIs.
  - Marketing: Direct mail, websites, SEO for SMBs.
- **New/Planned**:
  - **Deluxe Business Insights** (launched Sept 2024): AI analytics for customer retention (beta with 10K SMBs).
  - **Embedded Payments** (2024 rollout): White-label fintech via partnerships; pilot with regional banks.
  - DOXIM platform (post-Mar 2024 acquisition): Digital docs/comms; full integration Q4 2024, targeting $50M revenue add by 2026.

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current Approximations** (2024 estimates via company filings/IBISWorld):
  | Segment                  | Market Share | Notes |
  |--------------------------|--------------|-------|
  | U.S. SMB Checks/Forms    | ~45%        | Dominant; 4M customers. |
  | Merchant Acquiring (SMB) | ~2-3%       | Growing via DPX. |
  | FI Data/Treasury Tools   | ~10%        | Strong in community banks. |
- **Forecast**: Checks share stable/decline to 40% by 2026 (offset by digital +5% share gain in payments/data); overall revenue market share growth 1-2% annually via fintech pivot (per mgmt Q2 call).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (FY2023/TTM)      | DLX          | Jack Henry (JKHY) | SS&C Tech (SSNC) | Bottomline (acq. by Thoma Bravo) |
|---------------------------|--------------|-------------------|------------------|----------------------------------|
| Revenue                  | $2.28B      | $2.25B           | $5.6B           | $500M (pre-acq)                 |
| EBITDA Margin            | 20.8%       | 37%              | 28%             | 25%                             |
| Growth (YoY)             | +1%         | +7%              | +12%            | +5%                             |
| P/E Forward              | 9x          | 28x              | 20x             | N/A                             |
| Dividend Yield           | 4.4%        | 1.2%             | 1.3%            | N/A                             |
| Edge                     | SMB focus, checks moat | Core banking strength | Scale in alt assets | Treasury niche |

DLX trades at discount to peers due to check exposure but offers superior yield.

## Partnerships, M&A, & Clients
- **Partnerships**: Fiserv (co-branded SMB payments, 2023 expansion); NCR Voyix (POS integration, ongoing); QuickBooks ecosystem (embedded checks/data).
- **M&A**:
  - DOXIM acquisition (closed March 4, 2024; $120M cash; adds 1K clients).
  - Previous: First American Payment Systems (2022, $190M; boosted merchant).
- **Major Clients**: 4M SMBs (e.g., local restaurants/retail); FIs like Huntington Bank, credit unions (top 10 FIs ~20% FI revenue); merchants via DPX (e.g., QSR chains).

## Key Financials from Q2 2024 Earnings (Verified, July 31, 2024 Release)
| Metric              | Q2 2024     | YoY Change | FY2024 Guidance |
|---------------------|-------------|------------|-----------------|
| Revenue             | $593.7M    | +2.2%     | +1-2%          |
| Gross Profit        | $280.2M    | +3.5%     | -              |
| Adj. EBITDA         | $118.9M    | +3.1%     | +4-6%          |
| Net Income (GAAP)   | $42.8M     | -4.4%     | -              |
| Diluted EPS (Adj.)  | $1.06      | +24.7%    | $4.00-$4.20    |
| Free Cash Flow (TTM)| $102M      | -         | $200M+         |

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **6/10 (Hold)** – Stable cash flows/dividend support holding; limited upside from check drag but merchant tailwinds and 9x P/E undervalue growth potential. Avoid buy for pure growth portfolios.
- **Fair Value Estimate**: $28.00 (25% upside from $22.39). Based on 10-11x FY2025E EBITDA ($500M) at peer avg discount, DCF (8% WACC, 3% terminal), and 4-5% revenue CAGR. Moderate risk: Execution on digital shift key; suits income-focused with growth tolerance.
